page.title: 01Achnahaird Peninsula NE
page.content: The Achnahaird peninsula is a low lying area with a high lying range of hills. E W long the centre. The land is mainly uncultivated or improved with rough grazing for sheep. The Northerly coast has access by means of a single track road which services the village of Achnahaird with supplies from the nearest town Ullapool 20 miles away. The very small population is engaged in farming as its main source of income with one family supported by a caravan site which could hold 100+ vans if full, at Â£2 per night and 25p per person. There was no evidence of commercial fishing from the bay eventhough it was well suited to landing of boats in bad weather. one boat was used for lobster pot setting but this is not big business
